column4: Hello. Can anyone explain why GCC would be reporting that I don't have "math.h" functions, even though I have #include <math.h> at the top of my C program?
in C you need to include it. With C++ you do not confusing?
That would mean when you compile it you need to use the I flag to the path to where math.h is installed
use -lm flag to compile like . gcc -lm -o bo bo.c
